nationality.source: The defendant was born in Guangzhou in July 1956 and is 68.

age_at_offence.source: The defendant was born in Guangzhou in July 1956 and is 68. Particulars of the offence are that the defendant on 2 April 2022, at room 2110, 21st floor, Hoi Yan House, Hoi Fu Court, No.2 Hoi Ting Road, Tai Kok Tsui, Kowloon, unlawfully trafficked in dangerous drugs, namely, 17.3g of a crystalline solid containing 17.0g of methamphetamine hydrochloride (commonly known as “ice”)  and 14.40g of cannabis in herbal form.

age_at_sentencing.source: The defendant was born in Guangzhou in July 1956 and is 68.

gender.source: He relocated to Hong Kong when he was 21.

parental_status.source: The defendant contributes about RMB800 towards his daughter’s living expenses, who is 18 years old and studying nursing in Guangzhou.

conditions.source: The defendant suffers from cardiac disease, diabetes, kidney problems, hernia and polyps. He had undergone angioplasty procedure during his remand. He is constantly exhausted from frequent night time urination, and is in pain most of the time.
It may very well be true that the defendant was a drug abuser, and that urine tests showed that he might have taken some drugs before his arrest.

occupation.source: The defendant was working as a construction site worker in 2015, earning around $30,000, when he suffered a hand injury forcing him to stop.

monthly_wage.source: His health had since deteriorated and had to rely on CSSA of $5,300 per month for his daily and medical expenses since 2017.

criminal_record.source: The defendant has 19 convictions from 6 court appearances.

positive_habits_after_arrest.source: He has since quit his drug use and plans to be reunited with his daughter in the mainland upon release, and to never return to Hong Kong.

family_support.source: The defendant contributes about RMB800 towards his daughter’s living expenses, who is 18 years old and studying nursing in Guangzhou.
